definition:
The [*cube of a number*]{} $x$ is the third $x^3$ of $x$. Similarly one
may speak of the cube of an element $x$ in any semigroup with the
operation denoted multiplicatively (cf. general associativity).

The volume of a cube (i.e. ) with $a$ is $a^3$; hence the name.

The [*cube function*]{} $x\mapsto x^3$ from $\mathbb{R}$ to $\mathbb{R}$
is injective, but not as a mapping from $\mathbb{C}$ to $\mathbb{C}$;
one has $x^3 = y^3$ always when
$\frac{x}{y} = \frac{-1\pm i\sqrt{3}}{2}$, the third root of unity.
